definition: lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: All his life, Dr Huang served the people.
sentences.chinese: 黄医生为人民服务了一辈子。

sentences.english: In my life, I think to have a happy childhood is impassible.
sentences.chinese: 唉，我这辈子，是不可能有一个快乐的童年了。

sentences.english: She had the good fortune to BE in excellent health all her life.
sentences.chinese: 她一辈子身体都很好，真有福气。

sentences.english: If I tell you how I lost it you would hate me forever.
sentences.chinese: 如果我告诉你我是怎么弄丢的，你会恨我一辈子的。

sentences.english: Would you be like to play so, record my lifetime in television?
sentences.chinese: 你会像电视里演的那样记着我一辈子吗？

sentences.english: My friend said she never forget the delicious of the soup.
sentences.chinese: 朋友说，她这辈子也忘不了那锅鱼汤的鲜美。
养成好习惯，一辈子受用不尽。

sentences.english: I think that in this life, I never see who can come to fish with the branches of Salix.
sentences.chinese: 我想，这辈子，我再也见不到谁能用柳树枝来钓鱼了。

sentences.english: I want to buy a heavy-duty tool set that will last a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 我想买一套结实耐用的，可以使用一辈子的工具。

sentences.english: I always stick to be virginity to present the man who I will live together throughout my life.
sentences.chinese: 总是守着着份贞操留给和自己一辈子的男人。

sentences.english: To think, I could have lived all my life and missed it.
sentences.chinese: 想想看，我可能会活了一辈子而对此一无所知。

sentences.english: I've been in this stock business all my life.
Who hasn’t dreamt of visiting Paris once in this lifetime?
sentences.chinese: 谁不曾梦想在这辈子能去一次巴黎？

sentences.english: He was taught by his father to never let non-humans get the better of him in life.
sentences.chinese: 他的父亲教导他，这辈子千万不要输给非人类种族。

sentences.english: You are such a handsome man I have ever seen in my life.
sentences.chinese: 你是我这一辈子见过的最英俊潇洒的男人。

sentences.english: And then my oldest brother said, 'Morgan, people eat this their whole lives.
sentences.chinese: 我最年长的哥哥说，“莫根，人们一辈子都在吃这个。

definition: a whole lifetime (idiom); all my life
a few years/several years/how many years
to foreordain/to be bound to/to be destined to/to be doomed to/inevitably
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
